doc.field: Serbs want to suspend repatriation of Kosovo-Albanians

The Serb Government provisionally wants to suspend the repatriation agreement of Kosovo-Albanians with Germany. In Belgrade, the EU-wide landing restriction against the national Yugoslav air line was mentioned as the reason. In any case, the landing restriction makes all deportations to Yugoslavia impossible.

Poland declined the renewed demand of the exiled's association for compensation. Over radio Warsaw, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Geremec, said that this kind of payments will have to be made by the Federal Government in Bonn. For Poland, this affair is closed for all times. The exiled's association denied the maturity of Poland and the Czech Republic to join the EU. At the same time it had renewed its demand that both countries should only be allowed to join the EU after having granted the exiled the right to return and having paid compensation.
Hand grenade exploded in Bundeswehr barracks

In the Bundeswehr barracks in Amberg, Upper Palatinate (Oberpfalz), 21 soldiers were injured in an explosion of a splinter grenade. According to the Ministry of Defence in Bonn, one soldier's life is still in danger. The grenade detonated during an exercise in a training room. A speaker of the Ministry of Defence mentioned improper handling of the explosive as the reason.

A 46-year-old man goes on trial before a court on the charge of having tried to blackmail the Daimler-Benz trust. He threatened publicly to kill one Mercedes driver every week, if he did not receive DM five million.
Negative reaction on charge for consulting specialists

A huge majority declined the proposal of a DM 100.00 charge for consulting specialists without a medical prescription. Panel-doctors, health insurance companies and labour unions firmly rejected this proposal. The federal association of local health insurance companies called it a penalty tax for insured people. The charge was demanded by the chairman of the doctors' association of Schleswig-Holstein, Volkmann. He wanted to prevent expensive special diagnostics of specialists from being used too often.
Soccer: Vogts resigns as national coach

Berti Vogts is the first national coach in German soccer history, to resigns prematurely. Facing the extraordinary pressure from the public, he saw no possibility anymore to train the national team with the required strength in order to qualify for the European Championship. Vogts' predecessor, Franz Beckenbauer, proposes the ex-coach of Real Madrid, Jupp Heynckes, as new national coach.
Tennis: Graf eliminated from US Open, Gross in next round

In New York, Steffi Graf was eliminated from the US Open. In the eighth-finals, she lost to the Swiss player Schnyder (3:6 and 4:6). Oliver Gross is the only German, who has reached the eighth-finals in the men's competition. He won in five sets against player Jeff Grant from the United States.
